title: How do you grow tomatoes in pots? | wikiHow Asks a Plant Specialist
description:
Plant Specialist Monique Capanelli teaches you how to successfully grow tomatoes in pots. First, buy large pots for planting and cages to offer tender stalks a bit of extra support. Take your time preparing your pots and soil prior to planting and give your tomatoes plenty of sunlight and water.  Read more in this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Grow-Tomatoes-in-Pots
--- 
Monique Capanelli is a Plant Specialist and the Owner and Designer for Articulture Designs, an innovative design firm and boutique in Austin, Texas. With over 15 years of experience, Monique specializes in interior botanical design, living walls, event decor, and sustainable landscape design. She attended the University of Texas at Austin. Monique is a Certified Permaculture Designer. She provides plant and botanical design experiences, from small gifts to entire transformations, to shoppers as well as commercial clients including Whole Foods Market and The Four Seasons.
Learn more: https://www.articulturedesigns.com/

----

title: Growing Lavender - Quick Way to Harvest Lavender
description:
Susan at https://www.labyrinthhill.com demonstrates a quick, efficient way to harvest lavender bundles. One of the keys to harvesting lavender efficiently is having all your supplies at hand. Susan teaches this and other tips -- like timing your harvest -- in her course, Lavender: From Soil to Sachet.

Susan Harrington began growing lavender at Labyrinth Hill in 2002. Learn to grow lavender for fun and profit, even if you only have a small plot in your backyard. You can start right now with her free mini course: FREE Class— http://bit.ly/YT-free-mini-class

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
💜 💜 💜  Never miss a video about growing and using lavender. 💜 💜 💜 
👇 SUBSCRIBE NOW 👇
https://www.youtube.com/user/SusanHarrington?sub_confirmation=1

💜 FEATURED IN THIS VIDEO 💜

*Gardening Gloves: https://amzn.to/37HKG2O
*Rubber Bands (size 33 works the best!) https://amzn.to/2UcDqbc

Please understand that I have purchased the products or used services from these companies. subtitles: when I start the fresh lavender harvestI begin by first of all wearinggloves and then counting out the numberof bundles that I want to harvest whileI'm at this plant. This way the rubberbands are easily accessible and theharvest goes very quickly. Begin bycutting in the center of the plant whereyour stems are their straightest. Gathera large group and use your hand to help.In one fell swoop you have a bundleof lavender. Grab the rubber band. Wrap ittwo to three times. And it's ready withabout 75 stems.

title: How to Heat Milk
description:
Learn how to heat milk with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Heat-Milk

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to heat milk to a boil easily pour it into a microwave-safe container and heat it for about two and a half minutes stirring every 15 seconds so it doesn't scorch you can also pour the milk into a large deep pot and warm it over medium heat until it boils stir the milk every few minutes so it doesn't boil over and lower the heat when the milk starts to boil to avoid scorching it if you're heating milk for a baby pour the milk into a bottle then place the bottle into a pot of warm water until the milk has reached room temperatureto heat milk to a boil easily pour it into a microwave-safe container and heat it for about two and a half minutes stirring every 15 seconds so it doesn't scorch you can also pour the milk into a large deep pot and warm it over medium heat until it boils stir the milk every few minutes so it doesn't boil over and lower the heat when the milk starts to boil to avoid scorching it if you're heating milk for a baby pour the milk into a bottle then place the bottle into a pot of warm water until the milk has reached room temperature

title: How to Keep a Cut Apple from Turning Brown
description:
This quick video will give you some tips for keeping that cut apple from turning brown!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Keep-a-Cut-Apple-from-Turning-Brown

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to keep a cut Apple from turning brown combine one tablespoon of lemon juice and 1 cup 240 milliliters of water in a large bowl add your apple pieces to the bowl soak the apple pieces in the mixture for three to five minutes drain them and rinse them off with cool water if you aren't serving them right away put the apple pieces in a resealable bag and close it tightly taking care to remove all the air keep the cut apples in your fridge until you're ready to enjoy themto keep a cut Apple from turning brown combine one tablespoon of lemon juice and 1 cup 240 milliliters of water in a large bowl add your apple pieces to the bowl soak the apple pieces in the mixture for three to five minutes drain them and rinse them off with cool water if you aren't serving them right away put the apple pieces in a resealable bag and close it tightly taking care to remove all the air keep the cut apples in your fridge until you're ready to enjoy them

subtitles: if you want to keep broccoli fresh for a few days put the head of the broccoli stem down into a bowl with a little water like a bouquet place the bowl in the refrigerator and change the water daily to keep the broccoli fresh for five to seven days you can also wrap your broccoli and damp paper towels or place it into a ventilated plastic bag if you're going to use it within a few days regardless on how you choose to store your broccoli get it into the refrigerator as soon as possible after bringing it home youif you want to keep broccoli fresh for a few days put the head of the broccoli stem down into a bowl with a little water like a bouquet place the bowl in the refrigerator and change the water daily to keep the broccoli fresh for five to seven days you can also wrap your broccoli and damp paper towels or place it into a ventilated plastic bag if you're going to use it within a few days regardless on how you choose to store your broccoli get it into the refrigerator as soon as possible after bringing it home you

title: How to Keep Cilantro Fresh
description:
Learn how to keep cilantro fresh with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Keep-Cilantro-Fresh

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to keep cilantro fresh first trim off the bottoms of the stems then place the bundle of cilantro in a jar and fill the jar with enough water to submerge the stems cover the jar with a plastic sandwich bag and place it in the fridge your cilantro should stay fresh for about 4 weeks occasionally replace the water in the jar to keep the cilantro fresh hold off on rinsing the cilantro until right before you're ready to use it to freeze cilantro wash and thoroughly dry the cilantro then chop it up and spread the pieces out in an ice cube tray with a little water or olive oil store the cilantro in the freezer for up to six months to use your frozen cilantro just add it to soups sauces and dishes as you cookto keep cilantro fresh first trim off the bottoms of the stems then place the bundle of cilantro in a jar and fill the jar with enough water to submerge the stems cover the jar with a plastic sandwich bag and place it in the fridge your cilantro should stay fresh for about 4 weeks occasionally replace the water in the jar to keep the cilantro fresh hold off on rinsing the cilantro until right before you're ready to use it to freeze cilantro wash and thoroughly dry the cilantro then chop it up and spread the pieces out in an ice cube tray with a little water or olive oil store the cilantro in the freezer for up to six months to use your frozen cilantro just add it to soups sauces and dishes as you cook

subtitles: to keep guacamole fresh start by transferring it to a small bowl the less extra space the better then pour some lime juice or olive oil over the top of the guacamole to protect it from the air so it doesn't turn brown after that just cover the top of the bowl with plastic wrap and put the guacamole in the fridge until you're ready to eat itto keep guacamole fresh start by transferring it to a small bowl the less extra space the better then pour some lime juice or olive oil over the top of the guacamole to protect it from the air so it doesn't turn brown after that just cover the top of the bowl with plastic wrap and put the guacamole in the fridge until you're ready to eat it

subtitles: to infuse olive oil start by washing your fresh herbs and letting them dry completely overnight which will help prevent the growth of bacteria then place the herbs in a food processor and pulverize them for 30 seconds next add the herbs to a bottle and fill it to the top with olive oil refrigerate the bottle for one to two weeks so the flavors in the herbs infuse with the oil finally strain Andry bottle the oil once you're satisfied with the flavorto infuse olive oil start by washing your fresh herbs and letting them dry completely overnight which will help prevent the growth of bacteria then place the herbs in a food processor and pulverize them for 30 seconds next add the herbs to a bottle and fill it to the top with olive oil refrigerate the bottle for one to two weeks so the flavors in the herbs infuse with the oil finally strain Andry bottle the oil once you're satisfied with the flavor

title: How to Make a Baking Soda and Vinegar Rocket
description:
Learn how to make a baking soda and vinegar rocket with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Baking-Soda-and-Vinegar-Rocket

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to make a baking soda and vinegar rocket you'll need an empty plastic bottle three pencils duct tape a cork a paper towel baking soda and vinegar first use the duct tape to attach the pencils to the plastic bottle to make a stand for your rocket then place one scoop of baking soda in the middle of the paper towel and roll the paper towel up over it twist the ends to keep it secure next pour the vinegar into the bottle until it's halfway full take your rocket outside to a wide open area drop the pack of baking soda into the bottle and quickly close the bottle with the cork shake the rocket and stand it up on the ground and stand back carbon dioxide gas will build up in the bottle until the pressure pops out the cork and sends your rocket flyingto make a baking soda and vinegar rocket you'll need an empty plastic bottle three pencils duct tape a cork a paper towel baking soda and vinegar first use the duct tape to attach the pencils to the plastic bottle to make a stand for your rocket then place one scoop of baking soda in the middle of the paper towel and roll the paper towel up over it twist the ends to keep it secure next pour the vinegar into the bottle until it's halfway full take your rocket outside to a wide open area drop the pack of baking soda into the bottle and quickly close the bottle with the cork shake the rocket and stand it up on the ground and stand back carbon dioxide gas will build up in the bottle until the pressure pops out the cork and sends your rocket flying

title: How to Make a Balsamic Reduction
description:
Learn how to make a balsamic reduction with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Balsamic-Reduction

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make a balsamic reduction choose a high quality balsamic vinegar that is flavorful and sweet pour your balsamic vinegar into a wide shallow pan and bring it to a boil over medium heat if you want a sweet reduction to pour over fruit you can add sugar as you're heating the vinegar or you can add it at the end if you prefer once the vinegar reaches a boil turn the heat to low and simmer the vinegar for 10 to 20 minutes if you added sugar to your vinegar stir it occasionally to keep it from sticking to the pan allow the reduction to cool completely before servingto make a balsamic reduction choose a high quality balsamic vinegar that is flavorful and sweet pour your balsamic vinegar into a wide shallow pan and bring it to a boil over medium heat if you want a sweet reduction to pour over fruit you can add sugar as you're heating the vinegar or you can add it at the end if you prefer once the vinegar reaches a boil turn the heat to low and simmer the vinegar for 10 to 20 minutes if you added sugar to your vinegar stir it occasionally to keep it from sticking to the pan allow the reduction to cool completely before serving
